DOCNAME: CASE OF SABRI TAS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 5-3;Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Batman .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody in Batman by police officers from the Batman Anti - Terrorist Branch and he was held in custody until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s remand in custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE and on DATE ORG at ORG filed CARDINAL different bills of indictment accusing the applicant of being a member of an illegal terrorist organization and undermining the integrity of the ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG commenced the trial against the applicant and CARDINAL other suspects , and prolonged the applicant ’s detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG convicted the applicant under LAW , and sentenced him to life imprisonment . The charges had been brought under LAW .
CARDINAL . Thereafter , the ORG of cassation quashed the judgment CARDINAL times , remitting it to the first - instance court , which reached the same conclusions as before :
– Court of Cassation decisions quashing the judgments on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE ;
– the repetitive ORG decisions on DATE ( after numerous hearings ) , DATE ( after numerous hearings in the applicant ’s absence ) and DATE ( also after numerous hearings ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG convicted the applicant under LAW and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . He was released DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not appeal against this judgment . On DATE it became final .
CARDINAL . A full description of the domestic law may be found in the PERSON v. GPE judgment ( no . ORG , § § DATE , DATE ) .
